vivinoGuide.title: How to Export from Vivino
vivinoGuide.subtitle: Step-by-step guide to get your wine cellar data

note.title: Important Note
note.description: Vivino's export feature may vary by region and app version. If you don't see the export option, try using the web version or contact Vivino support.

step1.title: Open Vivino App
step1.description: Launch the Vivino app on your phone and tap on your profile/account icon (usually in the bottom right).

step2.title: Go to My Wines ‚Üí Export
step2.description: Navigate to 'My Wines' or 'My Cellar', then look for an 'Export' or 'Download' option in the settings/menu (three dots icon).

step3.title: Download CSV File
step3.description: Select 'Export to CSV' or 'Export Data'. The file will be downloaded to your device. Transfer it to your computer if needed.

method2.title: Method 2: Web Export (If Available)

info.title: Alternative Method
info.description: Some users can export from Vivino's website:

method2.step2: Go to your profile ‚Üí My Wines
method2.step3: Look for an 'Export' button or similar option

afterExport.title: After Exporting
afterExport.step1: Locate the downloaded CSV file (usually in Downloads folder)
afterExport.step2: Come back to this import page and click 'Choose File'
afterExport.step3: Select your Vivino CSV - we'll auto-detect it and map the columns!

q1.title: I don't see an export option
q1.answer: Try updating your Vivino app, or use the sample CSV template instead and manually enter your wines.

q2.title: The CSV doesn't import correctly
q2.answer: Make sure it's a valid CSV file. You can also download our sample Vivino CSV template and match the format.
